item.title: Definition of Intervals in Mathematics
item.description: Definition $$ [a,b] := \left\{ x \in \mathbb{R} : a \le x \le b \right\} \subset \mathbb{R} $$ For two real numbers $a \le b$, the set as described above is called an Interval. In particular, if both endpoints $a,b$ are included, it is notated as $\left[ a,b \right]$ using square brackets [] and is said to be Closed. If both endpoints $a,b$ are not included, it is notated as

item.title: Definition of Pi
item.description: Definitions Geometric Definition A circle is defined as the set of points in a plane that are at a given distance $r > 0$ from a given point. The ratio of a circle’s circumference $l$ to its diameter $2r$ is defined as the Pi $\pi$. $$ \pi := {{ l } \over { 2r }} $$ Analytical Definition 1 $$ E (z) := \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} {{ z^{k} } \over { k!

item.title: Arithmetic, Geometric, and Harmonic Means Inequality
item.description: Definitions For $n$ positive numbers ${x}_1,{x}_2,\cdots,{x}_n$, the arithmetic mean, geometric mean, and harmonic mean are defined as: Arithmetic Mean : $$ \sum_{ k=1 }^{ n }{ \frac { {x}_k }{ n } }=\frac { {x}_1+{x}_2+\cdots+{x}_n }{ n } $$ Geometric Mean : $$ \prod_{ k=1 }^{ n }{ { {x}_k }^{ \frac { 1 }{ n } } }=\sqrt [ n ]{ {x}_1{x}_2\cdots{x}_n } $$ Harmonic Mean : $$ \left(
